I would recommend "Downfall" and "White Night". Both movies are based on true events, and they both provide a glimpse into the lives of high-ranking individuals during significant historical periods.
In particular, I would highly recommend "Downfall", which is based on the real-life story of Adolf Hitler's last days in office as well as the aftermath of his resignation. The movie provides a detailed and nuanced account of the events leading up to Hitler's suicide as well as the subsequent investigation and trial by the Allied powers.
Overall, I would highly recommend "Downfall" for anyone interested in learning more about the events leading up to Hitler's suicide as well as the subsequent investigation and trial by the Allied powers.

| Plot: After finding a broken surfboard on his local beach, Jhonny Guerrero, a teenager from one of Peru' s toughest barrios, sets his heart on becoming a pro-surfer. With his father in prison for armed robbery and a mother struggling to feed and clothe his younger brother, the sea is his escape. When Jhonny is spotted by Peru' s most successful surf champion, Sofia Mulanovich, he is taken under her wing and given a chance to succeed. Yet the pressure to do so weighs hard. Without his dad around, the lure of his friends and the risks of life in the barrios threatens to jeopardize everything he' s worked for. When he' s injured outside a nightclub in a drive by shooting, Jhonny is forced to decide once and for all which path to take.
